required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Effect of Magnesium Sulphate on Analgesia Following Knee Arthroplasty
clinical_study.official_title: The Effect of Magnesium Sulfate Added to Levobupivacaine in Continous Femoral Block on Analgesic Requirements Following Total Knee Arthroplasty

brief_summary.textblock: This study is designed to investigate the effect of magnesium sulfate added to levobupivacaine in continuous femoral nerve block following total knee arthroplasty.

detailed_description.textblock: Pain after knee arthroplasty is a serious concern. This study was designed to investigate the effect of magnesium sulfate added to levobupivacaine in continuous femoral nerve block on analgesic requirements following total knee arthroplasty.

primary_outcome.time_frame: T0:(Baseline) Postoperative 1st hour, T1: Change in 2nd, T2: Change in 4th, T3: Change in 6th, T4: Change in 12th, T5: Change in 24th, T6: Change in 36th, T7: Change in 48th, T8: Change in 72nd hours
primary_outcome.description: measurement of postoperative pain using Visual Analogue Score. Minimum: 0 Maximum: 10. Higher values represent more pain, hence lower values are better

secondary_outcome.time_frame: T0:(Baseline) Postoperative 1st hour, T1: Change in 2nd, T2: Change in 4th, T3: Change in 6th, T4: Change in 12th, T5: Change in 24th, T6: Change in 36th, T7: Change in 48th, T8: Change in 72nd hours
secondary_outcome.description: Consumption of local anesthetic in patient controlled analgesia

arm_group.description: continuous femoral nerve block with levobupivacaine
continuous femoral nerve block with levobupivacaine and magnesium sulfate

intervention.description: Addition of magnesium sulfate as an adjuvant to levobupivacaine
continuous nerve block with levobupivacaine for treatment postoperative pain

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- scheduled for elective unilateral primary total knee arthroplasty
Exclusion Criteria:
- Patient refusal to enroll in the study
- Patient refusal of neuraxial anesthesia
- Existence of contraindications for neuraxial anesthesia
- Known history of allergy to any of the study drugs

facility.name: Ufuk University Faculty of Medicine Hospital

reference.citation: Albrecht E, Morfey D, Chan V, Gandhi R, Koshkin A, Chin KJ, Robinson S, Frascarolo P, Brull R. Single-injection or continuous femoral nerve block for total knee arthroplasty? Clin Orthop Relat Res. 2014 May;472(5):1384-93. doi: 10.1007/s11999-013-3192-3.
